Instrument_PDS3.instrument_desc:
Instrument Overview =================== The Cassegrain infrared camera uses a 58 x 62 pixel InSb array, manufactured by the Santa Barbara Research Corp., mounted in a He- cooled dewar. Mounted on the 5-m Hale telescope, with the f/70 secondary mirror, the plate scale is approximately 0.31 arcsec per pixel, for overall field of view of 18.2 arcsec by 19.4 arcsec. (NICHOLSON&MATTHE1991)
Filters ======= The 28 Sgr occultation observations were made using a circular variable filter (CVF). The CVF, with spectral resolution 0.0155, was tuned to a central wavelength of 3.9 microns in order to avoid saturation of the detector by the bright star while maximizing the contrast between it and the icy rings. (FRENCHETAL1993)
Location ======== The observatory location data given here are geodetic latitude and east longitude, based on values from the Astronomical Almanac, 1989. The geocentric site radius was determined using the MERIT 1983 earth figure, equatorial radius = 6378.137 km and flattening of the reference spheroid = 1/298.257.
Latitude: 33.356 Degrees Longitude: -116.864 Degrees Earth radius at observatory: 6373.400 Kilometers
